column4: if I install ubuntu over the PCLOS, I'm going to have to rewrite my /home and restore from backups, aren't I?
I mean, it won't just install / to the current PCLOS /, and use the current /home
but it will overwrite relevant config files in /home when necessary, right?
I have the whole /home backed up to a 320gb usb storage drive
m going to ditch PCLOS and come back to Ubuntu, now
thats one of the reasons of using a /home partition. If you use that, you can install wathever distro you want without worrying about losing your data/config
some of that things should not be missing. Most user dependent config are stored in $HOME
just "ls -al ~" and you will see the "hidden" config files
if it is the only user in the computer then it should work
or just sudo bash and then passwd
